results.title: To and fro
results.brief_description: A beautifully executed Flash animation that depicts the universal and unrelenting search for love. Selective use of detail and highly skilled illustrative qualities employ sophisticated visual storytelling conventions to produce a powerful emotional response within an epic framework.

results.title: To alter human behavior: without mind control (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Daniel Chaykin, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Investigates techniques underway. But raises ethical questions whether behaviour can be modified without subjects’ consent, and how to ensure that, having developed ways of altering behaviour, control remains in the right hands.

results.title: To Absent Friends
results.creator_credit: Ronnie Taylor, Paul Humfress and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This innovative documentary looks at the creation of the largest scale holographic project ever undertaken. Paula Dawson, the creator, is one of the world’s leading holographic artists and an important pioneer in this field. Inspired partly by Vladimir Nabokov’s book “Transparent things”, this work ” To absent friends” uses the central theme of memory through objects and allows the viewer to stand outside time and reflect on the past, or mirror. Paula’s installation was selected as one of forty works shown at Artec‘89, a high tech international art exhibition and competition, the first international Biennale in Nagoya, Japan. The three main holograms were exhibited and went on to become joint winners of the Grand Prix ‘89. This film presents the only opportunity to view the entire installation and to meet the artist who created it.

results.title: To a Safer Place
results.brief_description: Examines the story of how one woman has come to terms with her life as a survivor of incest. Sexually abused by her father from infancy to early adolescence, Shirley Turrotte is now in her thirties and has succeeded in building a rich and full life. Shirley discusses with her family, and describes her experiences as a victim of incest, the effects the abuse had on her and her siblings and the struggle in adulthood to come to terms with her past.

results.title: Tjurunga: the story of stone age man. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: A central Australian journey was undertaken by the well-known naturalist, C. P. Mountford. On that journey he was accompanied by a group of Aborigines, who took him to their tribal lands and showed him the legendary rocks and caves and trees and streams, all of which are an integral part of the culture of the desert tribes. Mountford’s camera recorded on this journey some of the most beautiful country in the Australian continent - the lands of the original Australians. Companion to “Walkabout: a journey with the Aboriginals”. Originally filmed in 1946, revised in 1972.

results.title: Tjilla trail
results.creator_credit: William M. Carty, Jeffery Kemp, British Petroleum and Cinesound
results.brief_description: Building the 265 mile railway linking the Mount Newman iron mine with Port Hedland, Western Australia. Shows the rapid mechanical construction methods used, with impressions of the country and its wildlife, including an 11 foot python called Charlie Boy. “Tjilla” means snake. Narrated by Gibson, a Thursday Island native with original music and lyrics by Jimmy Little.

results.title: Titsiana Booberini
results.creator_credit: VCA Film and Television School, University of Melbourne and Robert Luketic
results.brief_description: Internationally acclaimed musical story starring Tania Lacy as the ugly duckling check-out chick with a facial hair problem and Sophie Lee as the supermarket bully. This graduating film was so successful at film festivals around the world that its director was courted by Hollywood and went on to direct the box office hit ‘Legally Blonde’ (2001).

results.title: Titsiana Booberini
results.creator_credit: Robert Luketic and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Innovative, highly amusing tale of the ugly duckling who turns into a swan. Tania Lacy shines as the very plain, painfully shy and awkward shop assistant who has a crush on the Store Manager. Sophie Lee is equally as good as the bitchy beautiful shop assistant who gets everything her way. Presented as a musical, with ballet-like dance sequences, this quirky film is a classic tale which shows that beauty is, after all, only skin deep. Titsiana’s singing voice is provided by Sarah Liversidge.

results.title: Titanic (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jon Landau, James Cameron and Lightstorm Entertainment
results.brief_description: This sweeping love story sailed into the hearts of moviegoers around the globe, ultimately emerging as the most popular motion picture of all time. Starring Leonardo Di Caprio and Kate Winslet as star-crossed lovers who find themselves on the maiden voyage of the “unsinkable” R.M.S. Titanic. When the doomed luxury liner strikes an iceberg in the frigid North Atlantic, their passionate love affair becomes a thrilling race for survival. Winner of eleven Academy Awards including Best Picture, this tale of forbidden love and courage in the face of disaster triumphs as a true cinematic masterpiece.
